Harry S&orniav/
Harry Newburn
April 8, 1954
Mr. Robert R. Mullen, Executive Director
national Citizens Committee for Educational TV
1200 - 18th Street, N.W.
Washington 6, D. C.
Dear Bob:
You will recall the various divisions of labor that
were discussed last fall at the time of the meeting in Chicago
when you, Barry Skornia, Gray don Ausurus, Ralph Steetle and
Bob Hudson Joined with Scotty and me to clarify the general
picture of services in educational television. You will
recall that it was agreed by all present that: (l) In its
present stage of development the field could not afford to
support more than one personnel placement service; (2) That
this service was most appropriately the function of the
HAEB as the professional organization in the field; (3) That
the Fund would undertake to underwrite an appropriate service
on the part of the HAEB as soon as circumstances should permit;
(4) That with the establishment of this service on the part
of the HAEB, this function would cease to be the responsibility
of any other group operating under Fund support; (5) That until
such time as the HAEB service was in fact activated, the NCCET
might properly continue to collect such materials as might ccaae
its way preparatory to transferring them to the NAEB.
As a result of action taken over the past several
weeks, the HAEB has now received the necessary underwriting
from the Fund for the establishment of this placement service.
I understand from Harry Skornia that it is scheduled to be in
full operation as of May 1st*
It is our understanding here that as of this date the
HCCET will complete its transfer of materials to the HAEB;
that it will terminate its services of this type as of that
date; and that thereafter it will turn over to the HAEB any
inquiries or solicitations it receives.
